intro: Dianthus ferrugineus subsp. vulturius, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant characterized by its vibrant red or pink petals and distinctive seed pods. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is native to regions of Europe and western Asia. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The subspecies vulturius is distinguished by its more robust growth and slightly larger flowers compared to other varieties of Dianthus ferrugineus.
